review_text: The art style is absolutely adorable, I can't stop taking screenshots.
Such a relaxing game to unwind with after work.
The farming mechanics are simple but so satisfying.
I wish there were more furniture options for the bedroom.
The soundtrack makes me want to cry, it's so beautiful.
Perfect game to play while listening to a podcast.
NPC dialogue is repetitive, they say the same thing every day.
Fishing minigame is a bit too hard for a cozy game.
I love that there is no combat, just pure vibes.
Character customization is amazing, so many hairstyles!
The multiplayer co-op is buggy, couldn't join my friend's island.
Very wholesome community, everyone is so helpful.
Progression feels a bit slow, it takes forever to unlock the bakery.
The seasonal events are the best part of the game.
Inventory space is too small, I'm a hoarder!
Lighting effects during sunset are magical.
A bit expensive for the amount of content available right now.
Controls are intuitive and easy to pick up.
I spent 3 hours just designing my garden. 10/10.
Story is heartwarming, made me care about the villagers.
Needs a 'sort' button for chests desperately.
The cooking animations are so tasty looking.
Great game to play on the Steam Deck in bed.
Some textures look blurry when zoomed in.
I love the collecting aspect, filling the museum is fun.
The rain sounds are so soothing.
Not enough to do in the endgame, gets boring after 40 hours.
The cats in this game are so realistic!
No stress, no timers, just play at your own pace.
The crafting system is a bit grindy for materials.
Visuals are charming, looks like a Ghibli movie.
I encountered a glitch where my crops disappeared.
Relationship building with NPCs feels shallow.
The best town builder I've played in years.
Microtransactions for cosmetic items are annoying.
Map is huge, lots of secrets to discover.
The daily loop is addictive, 'just one more day'.
Can we please pet the dog? It's a crime we can't.
Tutorial is too long and holds your hand too much.
Performance is great on Switch, no lag.
The pixel art is top tier.
Clothing options are limited for male characters.
I love the feature where you can mail gifts to friends.
Weather effects are dynamic and change the gameplay.
Needs more accessibility options for text size.
The coffee shop update added so much charm.
Simply delightful, a warm hug in game form.
Mining is tedious, needs an auto-mine feature.
The economy is balanced, making money feels earned.
My favorite comfort game, highly recommend.
